channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2023120474

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded and placed on a conveyor belt. The damage was noticed and the package was removed from conveyor belt to be taken to hazmat area. DescribePack: One of the bottles in the package had a loose cap, allowing the liquid contents inside to leak out DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in hazmat bin and taken to damage area

item.title: Report E-2023120116
item.description:
Report E-2023120116

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-11
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, the connection between the hose and the trailer became compromised. This allowed approximately 8 gallons of gasoline to be released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2023120107
item.description:
Report E-2023120107

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: WILLIAMSPORT
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UPON ARRIVAL AT TERMINAL DRIVER DISCOVERED MATERIAL ON TOP OF CTMV. INVESTIGATION SHOWED DOME LID WAS NOT PROPERLY SEATED BY SHIPPER PERSONNEL. DRIVER OPENED LID AND RESEATED COVER ONTO GASKET THEN PROPERLY SECURED DOME COVER. RELEASED MATERIAL CLEANED BY DRIVER. NO ADDITIONAL INCIDENT WITH SHIPMENT.

item.title: Report E-2023120096
item.description:
Report E-2023120096

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: ELKRIDGE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While staging freight into temporary transit storage rack forklift operator struck the top chime area of a drum already staged in the rack slightly puncturing it consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum after it was repaired with drum putty to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023120089
item.description:
Report X-2023120089

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: GAITHERSBURG
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded off trailer, and placed on drivers van. Package handler noticed leakage and contacted manager. The package was removed from van, placed on designated hazmat container and placed in designated hazmat area for inspection. DescribePack: Body of Glass 1 gallon bottle broken. Seal and neck of bottle intact, DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed with arrows facing upward and package was taken to designated area

item.title: Report X-2023120056
item.description:
Report X-2023120056

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: WHITE MARSH
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE HAD BEEN DROPPED WHEN IT WAS BEING UNLOADED FROM THE TRAILER. THE IMPACT, CAUSED ONE OF THE JUGS TO CRACK IN THE BOTTOM SEAM. APPROXIMATELY 16 LIQUID OZ OF LIQUID LEAKED OUT. DescribePack: THERE IS A CRACK APPROXIMATELY 2 INCHES LONG, IN THE BOTTOM SEAM OF THE PLASTIC JUG. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS RETRIEVED, AND PLACED IN A BIN TO CATCH THE REMAINDER OF THE LEAKING.

item.title: Report X-2023111289
item.description:
Report X-2023111289

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-18
  • City: LANDOVER
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE CAME DOWN SLIDE TO "PULL" BAY. LOADER REPORTED TO BELT SUPERVISOR AND CONTACTED RESPONDERS. PULLED TRUCK OUT OF LINE-UP FOR FRESH AIR. RESPONDER, WITH HIS PPE(BOOTS,APRONS,GOGGLE,GLOVES), SPILL CART, AND WEARING REFLECTIVE VEST, RESPOND TO YARD PARKED TRUCK WITH DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. CONTAINERIZED WITH CLAY INTO SPILL TRAY. CORDON OFF WITH CAUTION TAPE W/4 ORANGE CONE,50 FEET FROM WATER SOURCE. PAPER TOWEL WIPED OFF TRUCK SHELF. CALLED FOR OUTSIDE RESPONDERS.

item.title: Report X-2023110752
item.description:
Report X-2023110752

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: SPARROWS POINT
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: discovered damaged on work area 1137.outer container was wet.upon inspection no internal partition.2 of the bottles had loose caps leaking out approx 15 oz of content total. DescribePack: failure was due to lack of a internal partition causing two bottles to have loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: loose absorb was used to address spill.package was placed in hazmat tote and put under ventilation system.
